title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: Those who have the opportunity would do well to drive out to Eagle Rock and South Mountain Reservation before the colored leaves have fallen from the trees and they stand bare to face the Winter blast.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: I turned down Eagle Rock avenue, passing Crystal Lake, a sheet of water right on the top of the mountain, and into Llewellyn Park.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: Prospect avenue was macadamized  under the direction of the Park Commisioners, and leads across Mount Pleasant avenue to Eagle Rock avenue, and from there to Montclair.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: After you emerge and begin to go down the hill there is a panorama only second to the one from Eagle Rock; the great city in the distance, and Staten Island, Kill van KuU, Newark and other cities and towns, hamlets and villages, farms, etc., scattered around on the plain beneath.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: Mounting the long hill, Eagle Rock Reservation is soon reached, and on the summit there lies before you one of the panoramas of the world.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: You go out Orange street to East Orange, turn into one of those diagonal  streets, which must have been a country road, Washington  street, pass Tory Corner, an old historic name which smacks of the Revolution, and continue on until you reach Eagle Rock avenue.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: Pleasant avenue  entrance straight through to Eagle Rock avenue, and elsewhere.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: South Mountain  Reservation and Eagle Rock are as yet a little too far afield.

title: Letters of Monsignor George Hobart Doane.
author: Doane, George Hobart
snippet: — Eastside, Westside, Weequahic Reservation, Branch Brook, Orange, Eagle Rock Reservation and South Mountain Reservation.

title: Notes of foreign travel.
author: Bates, James Hale
snippet: At another point, opposite Eagle Rock, Paddy awakened an echo repeated seven times, with lessening volume.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Moved by her story, the enemy let her pass; and she made herAvay to the top of the Eagle Rock, which rises behind the castle.
